poem:
"Before the Crossing"

In Rafah's shadow, unseen
Lie Israel's armoured engines of war,
Their grit-caked bodies preparing to tread 
Upon the Gaza's scarred earth.

Reservist brigades, stirred in their somnolence,
Mobilized for missions past the tranquil dawn.
In Rafah, the half-sheltered millions wait-
A held breath in the heart of the storm.

The Israeli military said on Wednesday that two reservist brigades had been mobilised for missions in Gaza, while video that circulated online". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
